text: This path is much closer if you want to go to Mcritchie Tree Top. But the path is quite muddy especially after rain. Quite flat throughout. You will pass by a small stream with rocks so it is kind of interesting. Try to wear good hiking shoes for this track. Parking is quite limited outside.

It is a place where Singapore's primary forest still exist. Wear good comfortable walking shoes, and insect repellant. You can find many insects especially butterflies in the late morning, monkeys, small birds, lizards commonly seen. Moths and bats and spiders are common sight at night, lucky enough you will see the rare slow loris, the civet cat, the flying squirrel and mousedeer. Visiting at night is not recommended with no street lighting in the area.

Rifle Range Link connect Rifle Range Rd to MacRitchie Reservoir Sime Track. The track is rugged as it is mostly natural. Do wear proper hiking shoes when trekking along this track cos sometimes it can be muddy. There is no toilet on this Trail.
Deep in our catchment area. Love how the pathways link up Macritchie to T15,Dairy Farm and even Bukit Timah Nature Reserves.

Straight path with elevation and depression that connects portion of MacRitchie Reservoir park (from Treetop walk) to the Rifle Range Road. At the end of the path is public road and sensitive installation (ST Engineering), Temasek Country Club, and Bukit Timah Plaza.
